caveats:
Information originates from multiple IATI reporting organisations, and has not been centrally vetted or audited for accuracy or consistency.  

Includes only those activities from the [IATI Registry](https://iatiregistry.org/) that are included in [D-Portal](http://www.d-portal.org) and have the status "Implementing".

The total number of activities may include duplicates, if (for example) a donor and an implementing partner both report the same activity under different IATI identifiers.

Start and end dates of activities within the dataset will differ.
license_other: Allowed licenses for IATI reporting organisations are listed at https://iatistandard.org/en/guidance/preparing-organisation/organisation-data-publication/how-to-license-your-data/
name: iati-tun
notes: Live list of active aid activities for Tunisia shared via the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI). Includes both humanitarian and development activities. More information on each activity (including financial data) is available from http://www.d-portal.org

organization.name: iati
organization.title: International Aid Transparency Initiative
organization.description:
IATI is a global initiative to improve the transparency of development and humanitarian resources and their results for addressing poverty and crises.

IATI brings together governments, multilateral institutions, private sector and civil society organisations and others to increase the transparency of resources flowing into developing countries.

IATI encourage all organisations that distribute or spend resources to publish information about their development and humanitarian activities using IATI’s data standard. This is a set of rules and guidance to ensure information is easy to access, understand and use. For more information visit [iatistandard.org](https://iatistandard.org/).

title: Current IATI aid activities in Tunisia

resources.description: Currently-active IATI activities in Tunisia, in 3W/4W style with HXL hashtags. This dataset has one row for each unique activity/sector/location, so the same IATI activity may occupy multiple rows: use the #activity+id column to count unique activities.
